paddingAPI.description: Adds an equal padding amount to specific edges of this view.

declaration.swift: nonisolated func padding(_ edges: Edge.Set = .all, _ length: CGFloat? = nil) -> some View

parameters.name: edges
parameters.description: The set of edges to pad for this view. The default is all.

possibleValues.description: Apply padding to top edge only
Apply padding to bottom edge only
Apply padding to leading edge only
Apply padding to trailing edge only
Apply padding to leading and trailing edges
Apply padding to top and bottom edges
Example of combining multiple edges using OptionSet syntax

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: An amount, given in points, to pad this view on the specified edges. If you set the value to nil, SwiftUI uses a platform-specific default amount. The default value of this parameter is nil.

returnValue.description: A view that's padded by the specified amount on the specified edges.

standardPaddingValues.description: SwiftUI provides platform-specific default padding when no explicit value is provided
standardPaddingValues.defaultBehavior: When length is nil, SwiftUI uses a platform-specific default amount appropriate for the platform and presentation context
standardPaddingValues.recommendedApproach: Use nil/default padding for standard spacing, explicit values for custom requirements

edgeSpecificPadding.description: Control padding on specific edges using Edge.Set values

singleEdges.description: Padding on leading (left in LTR) edge only
Padding on trailing (right in LTR) edge only

compositeEdges.description: Padding on both leading and trailing edges
Padding on both top and bottom edges

customCombinations.description: Combine multiple edges using OptionSet array syntax
customCombinations.note: Any combination of Edge.Set values can be combined

widgetSpecificPadding.description: Widgets should use scenePadding for appropriate content insets

recommendations.description: Adds padding appropriate for the current scene (widget, app, etc.)
recommendations.useCase: Use for widget content to respect safe areas and system margins

recommendations.description: Adds a specified kind of padding appropriate for the current scene
recommendations.useCase: Fine-grained control over scene-aware padding types

ScenePaddingType.description: The padding used to space a view from its containing scene
ScenePaddingType.note: Automatically adapts to widget size and platform requirements

widgetBestPractices: Use scenePadding() instead of fixed padding values for widget content margins
Let the system determine appropriate padding for different widget sizes
Combine with contentMargins for additional fine-tuning if needed

modifierOrderImportance.description: The order in which you apply modifiers matters significantly for padding
modifierOrderImportance.rule: Apply padding BEFORE applying border to ensure the border encompasses the padded region
modifierOrderImportance.visualImpact: Incorrect order results in border not including the padded space

codeExamples.title: Edge-Specific Padding Example
codeExamples.description: Demonstrates applying 20 points of padding to specific edges (bottom and trailing)
codeExamples.code:
VStack {
    Text("Text padded by 20 points on the bottom and trailing edges.")
        .padding([.bottom, .trailing], 20)
        .border(.gray)
    Text("Unpadded text for comparison.")
        .border(.yellow)
}
keyPoints: Uses array syntax to specify multiple edges

codeExamples.title: Default Padding Example
codeExamples.description: Demonstrates using platform-default padding on all edges
codeExamples.code:
VStack {
    Text("Text with default padding.")
        .padding()
        .border(.gray)
    Text("Unpadded text for comparison.")
        .border(.yellow)
}
keyPoints: No parameters means all edges with default amount
SwiftUI chooses appropriate default for platform
